An American vault-cracker (Zed) meets up with an old friend (Eric) in Paris. Eric and his gang have planned to raid the only bank in the city which is open on Bastille day. What's this new [HQ] stuff?

The new [HQ] line of encodes are specifically for large HD screens (as opposed to my other encodes which are more tailor-made for PC-viewing.) The [HQ] line will be exclusively encoded from physical blu-ray and not a master digital source file like most other encoders use. Bit rates and therefore file sizes will be substantially larger which is necessary to maintain picture quality on screens up to 60" but will still be not outrageously large to download. Audio bit rates on these will be 256kbps, an upgrade from the 160kbps of my non-HQ encodes (compare to YIFY's 96kbps or lower.) Video bitrates will be in the 4000-7000kbps range depending on content as opposed to 2250-2800kbps which I used for the non-HQ encodes. Good enough for screen sizes up to 32" or so, but not good enough for 50 or 60" screens. 

All of the extras were encoded using a CRF of 18 with TESA motion estimation method and most of the extras are in 576p since the source is PAL (the director's cut blu-ray of Killing Zoe was only released in France.) 


This is the Director's Cut of Killing Zoe. It is 3 minutes longer than the theatrical release.
